meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To provide for the publication of proposals as to works in relation to roads, objections to the proposals, authority to carry out the works and for the use of roads, powers in relation to the works on and the use of roads, compensation and connected matters.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Roads (Works, Use and Compensation) Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: building (建築物), Building Authority (建築事務監督) and building works (建築工程) have the same meanings as in the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123);

def.name: CompensatableInterest
def.leadIn: compensatable interest (可獲補償權益) means the estate or interest of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person having an unexpired term in land (including any further term which could be obtained as of right) of not less than one month or a tenancy or sub-tenancy terminable (whether by virtue of an Ordinance or otherwise) by either party by not less than one month’s notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a mortgagee in possession;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the holder of a valid and subsisting option to purchase an estate or interest referred to in paragraph (a) or (b);

paragraph.name: d

subsection.def: mortgage (按揭) means a mortgage or charge registrable in the Land Registry; (Amended 8 of 1993 s. 2)

def.name: Owner
def.leadIn: owner (擁有人), in relation to land, means the person holding that land—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: directly under a Government lease; or (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under another title directly from the Government registered in the Land Registry; (Amended 8 of 1993 s. 2)

subsection.def: sea-bed (海床) includes any Government land covered with water in any tidal river or channel connected with the water of Hong Kong; (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105)
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Transport and Logistics; (Replaced L.N. 106 of 2002. Amended L.N. 130 of 2007; L.N. 144 of 2022)
use (使用) means the use of any road, whether before or after the completion of any works and includes the existence of any road whether or not in relation to any use to which it is put;
works (工程) means the construction, renovation, alteration, closure, maintenance or repair of any road and any operations ancillary thereto;
works area (施工區) means the land delineated in the plan prepared under section 5.

subsection.leadIn: Where, under this Ordinance, notice is required to be served on any person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that notice shall be in writing and in both the Chinese and English languages;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it shall be served on that person by delivering it to him by hand or by registered post.

subsection.content: The Secretary shall not be obliged to serve any notice on any person whose address is unknown and cannot be reasonably ascertained.
A certificate purporting to be signed by a public officer shall be prima facie evidence of the facts stated therein relating to the service, giving, publication or affixing of any notice.

subsection.leadIn: The title to any land shall not be affected by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any defect in a notice required under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any failure to serve, publish or affix any notice under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Secretary may act under this Ordinance in relation to any works which he proposes be executed by some other person, other than a public officer, as well as in relation to works which he proposes be executed, on his behalf, by a public officer and this Ordinance shall apply to these works and the use.

Where the Secretary proposes that any works be executed by some other person, any compensation payable in respect of those works shall, subject to any agreement, be payable by the Government. (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 90)

The Secretary may in writing authorize any named person either generally or in any particular case to exercise any of the powers, functions and duties conferred or imposed upon him under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may execute any works—

subparagraph.content: only involve minor physical or structural operations; or
only create minimal adverse effect on the road users and other people in the neighbourhood; and (Replaced 25 of 2023 s. 75)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of which the only powers required by the Secretary are any one or more of the following— (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 75)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to close a road which, in the Secretary’s opinion, does not serve any useful purpose or does not serve any lawful purpose;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to close a road to use for a period not exceeding 14 days in any period of 3 months;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to close part of the width of a road to use but not to such extent as will interfere unreasonably with the normal flow of traffic on that road and for no longer than is reasonably necessary to execute the works.

subsection.content: The works executed under this section (including, if the exercise of a power mentioned in subsection (1)(b)(i), (ii) or (iii) is required, a closure mentioned in that subsection) and the use is authorized under this section.

A person does not have a right against the Government or any other person to restrain or compel anything authorized under this section or to recover any money under this Ordinance in respect of anything authorized under this section. (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 90)

To avoid doubt, nothing in this Ordinance prevents a person from recovering any money, under any other Ordinance or any rule of common law or of equity, in respect of anything authorized under this section. (Added 25 of 2023 s. 75)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Major works: The plan and the scheme
section.leadIn: Where the Secretary proposes to execute works, other than under section 4, he shall cause to be prepared—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a plan delineating the works area, being that area within which land may be resumed, easements or other rights in, under or over land may be created or rights affected for the purposes of or incidental to the works or the use; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a scheme, annexed to the plan, in which he shall—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: describe the general nature of the works which he proposes to carry out and the use to which he intends the road will be put;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: describe the land which he proposes may be resumed under section 13;

subparagraph.name: iii
iv
subparagraph.content: describe any road, Government foreshore or sea-bed in respect of which he proposes the Chief Executive may exercise his powers under section 17 and describe the manner in which the road, foreshore or sea-bed will be affected; (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105; 25 of 2023 s. 91)

subparagraph.name: v
vi
subparagraph.content: describe the nature of any apparatus in respect of which he proposes he may exercise the powers under section 20;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: describe the land or building in respect of which he proposes he may exercise the powers under section 21; and

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: describe any land or building works in respect of which he proposes the Building Authority may exercise its powers under section 22.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of preparing a plan and scheme mentioned in section 5 or any amendment or any substitute plan or scheme and failing agreement with any person affected as to the grant of the powers required by the Secretary, the Secretary may, subject to subsection (2), enter any land or building at all reasonable times and may there—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make any inspection, site investigation or test, including drilling, excavating and the installation or removal of instruments;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: survey and take levels;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: set out any line of works.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary shall give at least 28 days’ notice of his intention to exercise the powers mentioned in subsection (1) and that notice— (Amended E.R. 1 of 2021)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall describe the purpose of the entry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be served on the owner and occupier of the land or building.

subsection.content: Compensation shall be payable in respect of the exercise of the power mentioned in subsection (1) as it is payable under item 7 of Part II of the Schedule in respect of the exercise, of the power mentioned in section 19.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Amendment of plan and scheme
section.content: Any plan or scheme prepared for the purposes of section 5 and any marking or endorsement on any such plan may be amended and any plan or scheme may be replaced by a substitute plan or scheme but the Secretary shall as soon as practicable cause to be likewise amended, or replaced with the substitute, every copy referred to in section 8.

subsection.content: A copy of the plan and scheme prepared for the purposes of section 5 or 7, signed by the Secretary, shall be deposited in the Land Registry and shall be available for inspection by the public free of charge at such offices of the Government as the Secretary may direct, during the hours when those offices are normally open to the public. (Amended 8 of 1993 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary shall within 21 days of the deposit of a copy of a plan and scheme in the Land Registry or of any amendment to such copy or the deposit of a substitute plan and scheme cause a notice of such deposit or amendment to be published containing— (Amended 8 of 1993 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a description of the general nature of the works or of the nature and extent of the amendment to the works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: particulars of the places and times at which a copy of the plan and scheme, or details of the amendment or a copy of the substitute plan and scheme may be inspected by the public in conformity with subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: The notice mentioned in subsection (2) must be published— (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 76)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in 2 issues of the Gazette in both the Chinese and English languages;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: on the website specified by the Secretary; (Added 25 of 2023 s. 76)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in 2 issues of a Chinese language newspaper;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in 2 issues of an English language newspaper; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by affixing copies in the Chinese and English languages in such prominent positions within the works area as may be appropriate for the purpose drawing the notice to the attention of the public.

subsection.content: The Secretary must, by notice in writing, advise the District Council of the District in which the works are to be situated of the deposit of the plan and scheme under subsection (1) and, at the same time, supply that District Council with a copy of the plan and scheme. (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 76)
A copy of the plan and scheme shall be supplied to any person on application and payment of the reasonable cost of producing that copy.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Decision not to execute works
section.leadIn: Where the Secretary decides not to execute the works in respect of which a copy of a plan has been deposited under section 8, he shall, as soon as practicable, cause a notice to that effect to be published in the manner mentioned in section 8(3); and, upon that publication, the powers mentioned in section 6(1), 11(7), 13(1), 15(1), 17(1), 19(1), 20(1), 21(1), 22 or 23(1) shall cease to be exercisable in relation to those works:
section.proviso: Provided that this section shall not affect anything lawfully done under this Ordinance before that publication or any rights (including rights to compensation) then accrued under this Ordinance in respect of the exercise of any of those powers.

subsection.content: Any person may, by notice in writing delivered to the Secretary not later than 60 days after the first publication of the notice mentioned in section 8(2), object to the works or the use or both. (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 77)
A notice of objection shall describe the interest of the objector and the manner in which he alleges he will be affected by the works or the use.

An objection lodged on a ground relating to any compensation (whether monetary or non-monetary) or any financial or other assistance (compensation or assistance) in connection with the works or the use is, to the extent that it is lodged on that ground, invalid and treated as not having been lodged for the purposes of section 11. (Replaced 25 of 2023 s. 77)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3), the reference to a ground relating to any compensation or assistance includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a ground relating to whether any compensation or assistance is to be provided, whether or not under an enactment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a ground relating to the amount, extent or form of the compensation or assistance, or the time for its provision. (Added 25 of 2023 s. 77)

subsection.content: If the Secretary gives any written reply to an objection, the objector may give a response to the reply (including any comment on, or any request in connection with, the reply) within the period of 14 days after the day on which the reply is given. (Added 25 of 2023 s. 77)

For subsection (5), the mere notification by the Secretary that the objection is treated as unwithdrawn and will be submitted to the Chief Executive in Council does not constitute a reply. (Added 25 of 2023 s. 77)
A response that is given after the 14-day period mentioned in subsection (5) is treated as not having been given. (Added 25 of 2023 s. 77)

subsection.leadIn: An objector may, by writing to the Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend an objection lodged by the objector within the period for lodging objections; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: withdraw the objection in whole or in part before the plan and scheme are submitted under section 11(1A). (Added 25 of 2023 s. 77)

subsection.content: An objection (or a part of an objection) that has been withdrawn is treated as not having been lodged for the purposes of section 11. (Added 25 of 2023 s. 77)

subsection.leadIn: An objection, an amendment or withdrawal of an objection, or a response (referred to in subsection (5)) may be given to the Secretary by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: delivering it to an officer who is authorized by the Secretary to receive it on the Secretary’s behalf;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sending it by ordinary or registered post;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: sending it by electronic mail transmission to an electronic mail address specified by the Secretary; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: sending it by fax transmission to a fax number specified by the Secretary. (Added 25 of 2023 s. 77)

subsection.leadIn: A reply (referred to in subsection (5)) may be given to the objector by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: delivering it to the objector personally;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: leaving it at the objector’s last known address;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: sending it by ordinary or registered post addressed to the objector at the objector’s last known address;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: sending it by electronic mail transmission to the objector’s last known electronic mail address; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: sending it by fax transmission to the objector’s last known fax number. (Added 25 of 2023 s. 77)

section.name: s11
section.heading: Procedure after publication of plan and scheme

subsection.content: When the time for the lodging of objections has expired and where no objections have been lodged under section 10, the Secretary may execute the works; and the works and the use shall be authorized under this Ordinance.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Subject to subsection (1), the Secretary must, before the expiry of the period determined in accordance with subsections (1AB) and (1AC), submit the plan and scheme and every objection lodged under section 10(1) to the Chief Executive in Council for consideration. (Replaced 25 of 2023 s. 78)

subsection.name: 1AB
subsection.leadIn: Except as extended under subsection (1AC), the period mentioned in subsection (1A) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless paragraph (b) applies—5 months after the date of expiry of the time for lodging objections under section 10(1) in respect of the works or the use; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if one or more amendments are made to the plan or scheme under section 7—whichever of the following periods that ends later—

subparagraph.content: the period mentioned in paragraph (a);
3 months after the date of expiry of the time for lodging objections under section 10(1) in respect of the amendment (or the last of the amendments). (Added 25 of 2023 s. 78)

subsection.name: 1AC
subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may, on application by the Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: extend the period mentioned in subsection (1AB) for 2 months if the Financial Secretary considers it appropriate to do so in a particular case; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: further extend the period on not more than 2 occasions and for 2 months for each extension if the Financial Secretary is satisfied that exceptional circumstances exist in a particular case. (Added 25 of 2023 s. 78)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council shall consider the plan and scheme submitted and any objections lodged under section 10(1). (Added 14 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council, after considering the plan and scheme submitted and any objections lodged under section 10(1), may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: decline to authorize the works and the use; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: authorize the works and the use, with or without modification and subject to such conditions, as to the amelioration or avoidance of the effects of the works and the use or otherwise, as the Chief Executive in Council thinks fit. (Replaced 14 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Before exercising the power under subsection (2), the Chief Executive in Council may refer the plan, the scheme and the objections to the Town Planning Board appointed under the Town Planning Ordinance (Cap. 131) and— (Amended 25 of 2004 s. 25; 25 of 2023 s. 92)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Board shall, whether or not the works are shown on any draft plan under that Ordinance, exhibit and advertise the plan and scheme under section 5 of that Ordinance as if it were a draft plan, and the provisions of that Ordinance shall apply accordingly; and (Amended 25 of 2004 s. 25)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (a), the objections lodged under section 10 shall be regarded as representations made to the Board in respect of the plan and scheme under section 6 of that Ordinance. (Replaced 25 of 2004 s. 25)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may reconsider any plan and scheme and— (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 92)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: authorize the works and the use which the Chief Executive in Council has previously declined to authorize; (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 92)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remove or vary any modifications or conditions previously imposed.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, after the expiry of at least 28 days’ notice served on any person affected, amend any plan and scheme already considered and authorize the works and use in accordance with that amended plan and scheme. (Amended E.R. 1 of 2021; 25 of 2023 s. 92)

Where any objection has been lodged under section 10, the Secretary may execute the works only to the extent authorized, and subject to any subsisting modifications or conditions imposed, by the Chief Executive in Council. (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 92)

subsection.leadIn: Where any subsisting condition imposed by the Chief Executive in Council under subsection (2)(b) requires anything to be done by the Secretary to ameliorate or avoid the effects of the works or the use— (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 92)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: anything done by the Secretary in compliance with that condition shall be part of the works;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Secretary may enter any land or building, after giving at least 28 days’ notice to the owner and the occupier, and do what is required to be done to comply with that condition; and (Amended E.R. 1 of 2021)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the condition shall be deemed to have been met if the condition is met in respect of all the persons for whose benefit the condition was imposed other than those who waive compliance in writing.

subsection.leadIn: The notice mentioned in subsection (7)(b) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: describe the purpose of the entry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be served on the owner and occupier.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Secretary proposes to execute the works under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Chief Executive in Council has declined to authorize the works and the use; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Chief Executive in Council has authorized the works and the use; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Chief Executive in Council imposes any modifications or conditions when authorizing the works and the use; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any modification or condition previously imposed is removed or varied,

subsection.continued: that fact shall be published in the manner mentioned in section 8(3). (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 92)

section.name: s12
section.heading: Exercise of powers
section.content: Where the Secretary proceeds with the works under section 11(1) or the Chief Executive in Council authorizes the works under section 11(2), 11(4) or 11(5), then, subject to the terms of the scheme considered or amended by the Chief Executive in Council and to any subsisting modification or condition imposed by the Chief Executive in Council, the powers mentioned in section 11(7), 13(1), 15(1), 17(1), 19(1), 20(1), 21(1), 22 or 23(1) may be exercised for the purposes of or incidental to the works or the use.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Chief Executive may order resumption of land

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may by order direct that any land proposed for resumption in the scheme mentioned in section 5 shall be resumed for the purposes of or incidental to the works or the use. (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 91)

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (1) shall specify the period of notice to be given under section 14(2) which period shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: run from the day on which notice of resumption is affixed on or near the land under that section and in no case expire earlier than 28 days from that day; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prevail over any other period of notice of resumption (whether shorter or longer) provided for by the Government lease or other instrument under which the land is held. (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 77)

subsection.leadIn: Unless the Chief Executive has previously revoked the order made under subsection (1), the resumption of the land described in the order shall be effective upon expiration of the period of notice specified in the order and, thereupon, that land shall— (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 91)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where it is an undivided share in land, vest in The Financial Secretary Incorporated together with such rights to the use and occupation of any building or part thereof as may be appurtenant to the ownership of that share; and (Amended L.N. 180 of 1985)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in all other cases, revert to the Government, (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 77)

subsection.continued: but in either case the land shall vest or revert without any conveyance and free of all mortgages, charges, claims, estates, easements, rights or interests of any kind in favour of any person.

subsection.content: The ownership of any apparatus belonging to an owner or supplier of gas, electricity, water or telecommunications services and situated in, under or over any land shall not be altered by reason only of the vesting or reversion of that land under subsection (3). (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

The Secretary shall, as soon as practicable after land has vested in The Financial Secretary Incorporated or reverted to the Government under subsection (3), cause such vesting or reversion to be noted in the register of the land kept in the Land Registry. (Amended L.N. 180 of 1985; 8 of 1993 s. 2; 29 of 1998 s. 77)

Upon the vesting under subsection (3)(a) of an undivided share in land in The Financial Secretary Incorporated such share, together with any part of a building the exclusive use and occupation of which is appurtenant to ownership of such share, shall be deemed to be unleased land for the purposes of section 6 of the Land (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 28). (Amended L.N. 180 of 1985; 29 of 1998 s. 77)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), notice of resumption by order made under section 13(1) must be— (Amended 81 of 1988 s. 2; 25 of 2023 s. 79)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: served on every person known to the Secretary as having any estate, right, share or interest in the land mentioned in the order;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in one issue of the Gazette in both the Chinese and English languages;

subparagraph.name: 1a
subparagraph.content: on the website specified by the Secretary; (Added 25 of 2023 s. 79)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in one issue of a Chinese language newspaper;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in one issue of an English language newspaper; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: by affixing a copy in the Chinese and English languages in a prominent position on or near the land mentioned in the order; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: made available for inspection by the public free of charge at such offices of the Government as the Secretary may direct, during the hours when those offices are normally open to the public.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of resumption shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: describe the land to be resumed and state that an order has been made under section 13(1) in respect thereof;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: state the day on which the notice was affixed on or near the land;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: state the period of notice specified by the Chief Executive under section 13(2); (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 91)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: declare that upon the expiry of that period the land described in the notice shall by virtue of section 13(3) revert to the Government or vest in The Financial Secretary Incorporated, as the case may require, for the purposes of or incidental to the works or the use; and (Amended L.N. 180 of 1985; 29 of 1998 s. 105)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: state that any person entitled to compensation under this Ordinance may serve a written claim upon the Secretary.

subsection.content: Where an order has been made under section 13(1) in respect of land which was, when the order was made, a road, subsection (1)(a) of this section shall not apply. (Added 81 of 1988 s. 2)

section.name: s15
section.heading: Chief Executive may order creation of easements and other rights

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may by order direct that easements or other permanent rights in, under or over land and rights of temporary occupation of land in the works area which easements and rights were proposed in the scheme mentioned in section 5 shall be created in favour of the Government for the purposes of or incidental to the works or the use. (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105; 25 of 2023 s. 91)

An order under subsection (1) shall specify the period of notice to be given under section 16(2) which period shall run from the day on which notice of creation of an easement or right is affixed to the land under that subsection and shall in no case expire earlier than 28 days from that day.

An order made under subsection (1) may contain such consequential and incidental provisions as appear to the Chief Executive to be necessary or expedient for the purposes of the order including in particular provisions for authorizing persons to enter upon land or buildings in accordance with subsection (5) for the purpose of carrying out any operations or installing, maintaining or removing any structures or apparatus. (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 91)

Unless the Chief Executive has previously revoked the order made under subsection (1), upon the expiry of the period specified under subsection (2) the easement or right shall be created in favour of the Government and the benefits and obligations thereof and of all consequential and incidental provisions made under subsection (3) shall be of full force and effect against all persons having any estate, right, share or interest in the land without any consent, grant or conveyance. (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105; 25 of 2023 s. 91)

No person shall, in the exercise of any power of entry referred to in subsection (3), enter upon any land which is occupied without giving at least 28 days’ notice of his intention so to do unless the Secretary is of the opinion that an emergency exists which necessitates immediate entry.
Notice under subsection (5) shall be served on the owner and the occupier of the land.

The ownership of any thing shall not be altered by reason only that it is placed in or under or affixed to any land in exercise of the rights and powers arising from or incidental to an easement or right created under this section.

The Secretary shall, as soon as practicable after an easement or other permanent right has been created in favour of the Government under subsection (4), cause the creation of such easement to be noted in the register of the land kept in the Land Registry. (Amended 8 of 1993 s. 2; 29 of 1998 s. 105)

section.name: s16
section.heading: Notices of creation of easements or other rights

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), notice of creation of an easement or right by order made under section 15(1) must be— (Amended 81 of 1988 s. 3; 25 of 2023 s. 80)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: served on every person known to the Secretary as having any estate, right, share or interest in the land mentioned in the order;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in one issue of the Gazette in both the Chinese and English languages;

subparagraph.name: 1a
subparagraph.content: on the website specified by the Secretary; (Added 25 of 2023 s. 80)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in one issue of a Chinese language newspaper;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in one issue of an English language newspaper; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: by affixing a copy in the Chinese and English languages in a prominent position on or near the land mentioned in the order; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: made available for inspection by the public free of charge at such offices of the Government as the Secretary may direct, during the hours when those offices are normally open to the public.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of creation of an easement or right shall—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: state the day on which the notice was affixed on or near the land;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: state the period of notice specified by the Chief Executive under section 15(2); (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 91)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: declare that upon the expiry of that period the easement or right described in the notice shall by virtue of section 15(4) be created in favour of the Government for the purposes of or incidental to the works or the use; and (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: state that any person having a compensatable interest under this Ordinance may serve a written claim upon the Secretary.

subsection.content: Where an order has been made under section 15(1) in respect of land which was, when the order was made, a road, subsection (1)(a) of this section shall not apply. (Added 81 of 1988 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive may, for the purposes of or incidental to the works or the use, in relation to any road, Government foreshore or sea-bed described in the scheme mentioned in section 5, by order— (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 91)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: direct that the road or part thereof shall be closed; (Replaced 8 of 1987 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: direct that the Government foreshore or sea-bed shall be reclaimed; (Replaced 8 of 1987 s. 2)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: declare that, or the extent to which, and the time at, or duration for which, any public or private right in, upon, under or over the road, Government foreshore or sea-bed shall be extinguished, modified or restricted.

subsection.content: Where an order is made under subsection (1) every public and private right in, upon, under or over the road, Government foreshore or sea-bed affected by the order shall be extinguished, modified or restricted according to the provisions in that behalf made in the order.
This section shall not affect the provisions of the Road Traffic Ordinance (Cap. 374) relating to the closure of roads.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Notices of orders made under section 17

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), notice of an order made under section 17(1) in respect of any road, foreshore or sea-bed must be— (Amended 81 of 1988 s. 4; 25 of 2023 s. 81)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: served on every person known to the Secretary as having any estate, right, share or interest in the land mentioned in the order;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in one issue of the Gazette in both the Chinese and English languages;

subparagraph.name: 1a
subparagraph.content: on the website specified by the Secretary; (Added 25 of 2023 s. 81)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in one issue of a Chinese language newspaper;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in one issue of an English language newspaper; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: by affixing a copy in the Chinese and English languages in a prominent position on or near the land mentioned in the order; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: made available for inspection by the public free of charge at such offices of the Government, as the Secretary may direct during the hours when those offices are normally open to the public.

subsection.leadIn: The notice referred to in subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: describe briefly any works to be carried out;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: state the day on which the notice was affixed on or near the land; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: state that any person having a compensatable interest under this Ordinance may serve a written claim upon the Secretary.

subsection.content: Where an order has been made under section 17(1) in respect of a road, subsection (1)(a) of this section shall not apply. (Added 81 of 1988 s. 4)

section.name: s19
section.heading: Inspection and preventive and remedial works on land and buildings

subsection.leadIn: Failing agreement with any person affected as to the grant of the powers required by the Secretary, the Secretary may enter any land or building described in the scheme mentioned in section 5 and situate wholly or partly within the works area or wholly or partly within 70 metres thereof for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: making any inspection, valuation, site investigation or test, including drilling, excavation or the installation or removal of instruments;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: surveying or taking levels;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: setting out any line of works,

subsection.continued: in connexion with the works, the use, an assessment of the value of any land, building or other property or in order to ascertain the condition of the land or building; and the Secretary may also enter any such land or building and carry out, at the cost of the Government, all reasonably necessary operations of a preventive or remedial nature. (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 90)

subsection.content: No person shall, for the purposes of subsection (1), enter any land or building which is occupied without giving at least 28 days’ notice of his intention so to do, unless the Secretary is of the opinion that an emergency exists which necessitates immediate entry.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of entry referred to in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall describe the purpose of the entry and the nature of any operations to be carried out; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be served on the owner and the occupier of the land or building.

subsection.def: In subsection (1) operations of a preventive or remedial nature (屬預防或補救性質的作業) means the underpinning or strengthening of any land or building and other work thereon intended to render it reasonably safe or to repair or detect damage caused by the works or the use.

subsection.content: The decision of the Secretary that any operations are of a preventive or remedial nature or that such operations are reasonably necessary shall be final.

The Secretary may, as occasion may require, enter any land or building in respect of which any of the powers contained in subsection (1) have been exercised and may in relation to that land or building exercise such powers, subject to subsection (2), as often as occasion may require.

The Secretary may give notice to the owner of any gas, electricity, water or telecommunications service apparatus situated on any unleased Government land requiring him, at his own expense (subject to any contract between that owner and the Government), to alter the course or position of any wire, line, cable, pipe, tube, casing, duct, post or other apparatus the nature of which was described in the scheme mentioned in section 5 and which belongs to or is maintained by that owner and to repair any road surface thereby disturbed if in the opinion of the Secretary such alteration and repair is required for the purposes of or incidental to the works or the use. (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify the nature of apparatus to which the notice applies and set out the Secretary’s requirements as to the alteration of its course or position and the repair of any road surface;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stipulate the period within which such work shall be carried out; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be served upon the owner not later than 1 month before the commencement of that period.

subsection.content: The period mentioned in subsection (2)(b) shall be a period which is reasonably necessary for the carrying out of the Secretary’s requirements as mentioned in subsection (2)(a) and, before stipulating a period, the Secretary shall consult the owner of the apparatus to which the notice applies.

If the owner does not comply with the notice given to him under subsection (1), the Secretary may carry out the operations mentioned in that notice and, subject to any contract between that owner and the Government, recover the cost thereof from the person to whom the notice was given.

The Secretary may give notice to the owner of any land or building described in the scheme mentioned in section 5 requiring him to remove any object or structure described in the notice which is attached to or projects from the land or building if in the opinion of the Secretary the removal of the object or structure is necessary for the purposes of or incidental to the works or the use.
A copy of the notice under subsection (1) shall be given to any occupier of the land or building known to the Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: describe the object or structure to be removed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stipulate the period within which the work of removal shall be carried out;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be given to the owner and occupier of the land or building not later than 28 days before the commencement of that period; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: state that any person having a compensatable interest under this Ordinance may serve a written claim upon the Secretary.

subsection.content: If the owner of the land or building does not comply with a notice given to him under subsection (1), the Secretary may enter the land or building, together with such other persons as he thinks necessary, and remove the object or structure described in the notice or cause it to be removed by those other persons at the expense of the Government. (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 90)

An object or structure removed under subsection (4), whether or not it was erected or maintained in contravention of any Ordinance or Government lease or other instrument under which the land is held, may be disposed of as the Secretary thinks fit. (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105)

section.name: s22
section.heading: Control of building plans and commencement of work

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123), where the Building Authority is of the opinion that any building works on land described in the scheme mentioned in section 5 would be incompatible with the works or the use, he may to such extent as is necessary to avoid such incompatibility—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refuse to give his approval to any plan or to consent to the commencement of the building works;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: require the amendment of any plan relating to the building works;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: impose conditions, whether as to time or otherwise, on the giving of approval to plans relating to the building works or consent to commence such works.

subsection.leadIn: The carrying out of any building works—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contrary to any refusal under subsection (1)(a) or following any withdrawal of approval under subsection (1)(b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise than in accordance with any plan amended under subsection (1)(c) or condition imposed under subsection (1)(d),

subsection.continued: shall, for the purposes of sections 23 and 24 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123), be deemed to constitute a contravention of that Ordinance.

content.leadIn: The powers of the Building Authority under this section shall arise as soon as a plan, a substitute plan or an amendment to a plan has been deposited under section 8(1):

proviso.name: proviso
proviso.leadIn: Provided that, as soon as reasonably practicable after the Chief Executive in Council has made a decision under section 11(2) or 11(4), the Building Authority shall— (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 92)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: review his action under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: vary such action so that it is consistent with that decision.

subsection.content: Where the Building Authority acts under subsection (1), he shall advise the person who intends to carry out the building works of the particulars in respect of which he is of the opinion that the building works would be incompatible with the works or the use.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Building Authority refuses, under subsection (1)(a), to give his approval to any plan or to consent to the commencement of the building works or withdraws, under subsection (1)(b), any approval; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he maintains a refusal or withdrawal after reviewing his action under the proviso to subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: he advises, under subsection (4), that any building works on the land specified by him would be incompatible with the works or the use; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the building works and any plan relating thereto are consistent with the Government lease or other instrument under which the land is held and with any law or requirement made under any law, (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105)

subsection.continued: the owner of that land may, by notice in writing to the Secretary, require that the land mentioned in paragraph (c) be resumed under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Building Authority imposes, under subsection (1)(d), a condition delaying building works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he maintains that condition after reviewing his action under the proviso to subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: he does not, on application in writing made not less than 2 years after imposition of that condition, grant approval and consent to commence the building works to allow them to commence within 12 months; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the building works and any plan relating thereto are consistent with the Government lease or other instrument under which the land is held and with any law or requirement made under any law, (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105)

subsection.continued: the owner of that land may, by notice in writing to the Secretary, require that the land mentioned in paragraph (c) be resumed under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Where the owner gives notice under subsection (5) or (6), the Chief Executive shall, unless the notice is withdrawn, make an order under section 13(1) in respect of the land mentioned in paragraph (c) of subsection (5) or (6) not more than 28 days after receipt of the notice by the Secretary, and the period of notice specified in the order under section 13(2) shall be not longer than 28 days. (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 91)

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Building Authority imposes, under subsection (1)(d), a condition delaying building works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he maintains that condition after reviewing his action under the proviso to subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: he advises, under subsection (4), that, for any period specified by him, building works on the land specified by him would be incompatible with the works or the use; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the building works and any plan relating thereto are consistent with the Government lease or other instrument under which the land is held and with any law or requirement under any law, (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105)

subsection.continued: any person having a compensatable interest in that land may apply to the Chief Executive in Council for an order that the land mentioned in paragraph (c) be resumed under this Ordinance and the Chief Executive in Council may, if he thinks it just and equitable to do so, make such an order. (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 92)

subsection.content: Where the Chief Executive in Council makes an order under subsection (8), the Chief Executive shall make an order under section 13(1) in respect of the land mentioned in paragraph (c) of subsection (8) not more than 28 days after the order under subsection (8) and the period of notice specified in the order under section 13(2) shall be not longer than 28 days. (Amended 25 of 2023 ss. 91 & 92)

subsection.leadIn: Where any land is resumed under section 13 (other than on application under this section) (resumed land), any road is closed or any private right extinguished, modified or restricted under section 17 and the Chief Executive is of the opinion that— (Amended 25 of 2023 ss. 82 & 91)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the resumed land, road or right is reasonably necessary to the use and enjoyment of any contiguous or adjacent land; and (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 82)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it would be just and equitable to make an order under this subsection,

subsection.continued: the Chief Executive may, on the application of any person having a compensatable interest in that contiguous or adjacent land, make an order under section 13(1) in respect of that contiguous or adjacent land, whether or not it is within the works area. (Amended L.N. 446 of 1994)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The application must be made before the expiry of—

subparagraph.content: the date of the resumption of the resumed land; or
the date on which the road is closed or the private right is extinguished, modified or restricted; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a further period allowed by the Chief Executive in a particular case. (Added 25 of 2023 s. 82)

subsection.content: Any person aggrieved by a decision of the Chief Executive under subsection (1) not to make an order under section 13(1) may apply to the Lands Tribunal to review such decision.

Upon an application under subsection (2), the Lands Tribunal may, if it is satisfied as to the facts mentioned in subsection (1), make an order under section 13(1) in respect of the contiguous or adjacent land, whether or not it is within the works area.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Obstruction
section.content: Any person who wilfully obstructs any person lawfully exercising or performing any power, duty or function arising under this Ordinance shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Rights to Compensation and Claims Procedure

section.name: s25
section.heading: No right to compel or restrain
section.content: No person shall have any right against the Government or any other person to restrain or compel anything authorized under this Ordinance.

section.name: s26
section.heading: No recovery of money except under this Ordinance
section.leadIn: No person shall have any right against the Government or any other person to recover any money— (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 90)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of any use authorized under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of any works or anything else authorized under this Ordinance except to the extent of the rights to compensation provided for in section 27.

subsection.leadIn: The compensation referred to in section 26 is the right to recover from the Government for the matters set out in the first column of Part II of the Schedule a sum assessed on the basis specified opposite thereto in the second column thereof and with regard to the provisions of Part I of the Schedule, subject to— (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 90)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the other provisions of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Every person who is described in the third column of Part II of the Schedule shall have the right to recover compensation for the matters set out opposite thereto in the first column to the extent suffered or incurred by him as assessed under this Ordinance.

The rights to compensation mentioned in the Schedule shall exist in addition to any benefit accruing to a claimant as a result of the implementation of any subsisting conditions imposed by the Chief Executive in Council under section 11(2). (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 92)

Subject to subsections (2) and (6), if a claim or an amendment thereto is not served on the Secretary before the expiration of the period specified in the fourth column of Part II of the Schedule in respect of that matter, the right to claim compensation therefor shall be barred. (Amended 81 of 1988 s. 5)
The period referred to in subsection (1) may, upon application made to the Lands Tribunal either before or after the expiry of that period, be extended in accordance with this section.
Notice of an application under subsection (2) shall be given to the Secretary by the applicant.

The Lands Tribunal may extend the period within which a claim must be served upon the Secretary if it considers that the delay in serving the claim was occasioned by mistake of fact or mistake of any matter of law (other than the relevant provision in the fourth column of Part II of the Schedule) or by any other reasonable cause or that the Government is not materially prejudiced in the conduct of its case or otherwise by the delay. (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 90)

An extension may be granted by the Lands Tribunal under subsection (4), with or without conditions for such period as it thinks fit but not in any case exceeding 6 years from the time when the right to compensation first arose.

Without prejudice to subsections (2) to (5), where an order has been made under section 13(1), 15(1) or 17(1) and notice of the order has not been served in accordance with section 14(1)(a), 16(1)(a) or 18(1)(a) respectively, the Secretary may, if satisfied that the claimant has not had actual notice of the order, accept service of a claim after the period specified in the fourth column of Part II of the Schedule for such service, and if he does so, the claim shall be deemed to have been served within that period. (Added 81 of 1988 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who claims to be entitled to compensation under this Ordinance shall serve upon the Secretary a written claim setting out such of the following particulars as are applicable to his claim—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the claimant, and his address for service of notices;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a full description of the land to which the claim relates including any covenants, easements, rights or restrictions affecting the same;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the nature of the claimant’s interest in the land including in the case of a sub-lessee or sub-tenant his landlord’s name and address and details of the sub-lease or tenancy;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: details of any mortgage, including the principal still owing and name and address of the mortgagee;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the claimant has let the land or any part thereof, the name and address of each tenant and details of his lease or tenancy;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount of the claim;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under which item of Part II of the Schedule the claim is made; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: how the amount claimed under each item is calculated.

subsection.content: The Secretary shall in writing acknowledge receipt and the date of receipt of every claim served on him under subsection (1).

If a claimant amends his claim before proceedings are commenced in the Lands Tribunal and the Secretary considers the amendment to be substantial, the Secretary may, within 28 days of the receipt of the amended claim, notify the claimant that he elects to treat the claim, for the purposes of this section, as if it were a new claim served under subsection (1) on the date on which the amendment was received by the Secretary, and this section shall apply accordingly.

The Secretary may by notice in writing to the claimant request him to furnish further particulars of and in support of his claim or any item thereof and if any such particulars are not furnished to the Secretary within a period of 28 days from the date of the notice, or within such further period as the Secretary may in writing allow, the claim or the item thereof concerning which the particulars are requested shall be deemed to be rejected and subsection (5) shall not apply thereto.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary shall within 6 months of the service of a claim on him or, if he has requested further particulars under subsection (4) within 6 months of the day on which they are furnished in accordance with that subsection, notify the claimant in writing that he—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: admits the entire claim; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rejects the entire claim; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: admits a specified part or parts and rejects the remainder,

subsection.continued: and in every case shall briefly state his reasons for rejection so that the claimant is adequately informed of those reasons:
subsection.proviso: Provided that the Secretary may at any time state further reasons for rejection of claim.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Secretary has rejected a claim or any part thereof under subsection (5) or where a claim or any part thereof is deemed to have been rejected under subsection (4) the Secretary may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by notice in writing offer to the claimant such sum, including costs as agreed or taxed, as the Government is willing to pay in full and final settlement of the claim or any part thereof; (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 90)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: commence proceedings in the Lands Tribunal, to have the claim or any part thereof in respect of which no offer is made heard and determined by it in accordance with this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: commence such proceedings in the Lands Tribunal where any offer under paragraph (a) is not accepted by the claimant within 28 days of the date of the offer.

subsection.content: If, after the expiry of 7 months from the receipt of a claim by the Secretary, it has not been settled by agreement, either the claimant or the Secretary may commence proceedings in the Lands Tribunal to have the claim, or so much thereof as is still then in dispute heard and determined by it under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In any case where the claimant has failed to supply further particulars required by the Secretary in accordance with subsection (4), the Lands Tribunal may on the hearing of the claim consider the merits of the Secretary’s request for further particulars and the claimant’s failure to supply them and may, if it thinks fit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: order the claimant to supply some or all of the particulars; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: adjourn the hearing until the order is complied with and the particulars are considered by the Secretary; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make such further order as it thinks fit as to the costs of either party occasioned by the Secretary’s request for and the claimant’s failure to supply the further particulars.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Settlement after reference to Lands Tribunal

subsection.content: At any time after proceedings have been commenced in the Lands Tribunal but before compensation is finally assessed the Secretary may make an offer in writing of the kind described in section 29(6)(a) or the claimant may by notice to the Secretary state a sum (inclusive or exclusive of costs) which he is willing to accept in full and final settlement of his claim or any rejected part thereof.

Where an offer made by the Secretary pursuant to section 29(6)(a) or by the Secretary or the claimant pursuant to subsection (1) is not accepted by the other party, no part of the contents thereof which relates to any part of a claim before the Lands Tribunal shall be disclosed to that Tribunal until the amount of compensation for that part is assessed by it; but a copy of the offer enclosed in a sealed envelope may be lodged with the registrar of the Lands Tribunal and opened by it after it has made its assessment. (Amended L.N. 446 of 1994)

Where the Secretary has made any offer under section 29(6)(a) or subsection (1), including costs as agreed or taxed, which is not accepted by the claimant and the compensation assessed by the Lands Tribunal does not exceed the amount of compensation comprised in the offer, the Lands Tribunal shall, unless for special reason it thinks it proper not to do so, order the claimant to bear his own costs and to pay the costs of the Secretary in so far as the costs are incurred after the making of the offer.

Where the claimant states a sum which he is willing to accept under subsection (1) which is not paid by the Secretary and the compensation assessed by the Lands Tribunal is not less than that sum, the Lands Tribunal shall, unless for special reason it thinks it proper not to do so, order the Secretary to bear his own costs and to pay the costs of the claimant.

subsection.leadIn: The Lands Tribunal shall have jurisdiction to hear and determine in accordance with this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all claims for compensation which the Secretary or the claimant may refer to it under section 29(6) or (7); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: applications provided for by sections 23(2) and 28(2).

subsection.content: The Lands Tribunal shall also have jurisdiction to award compensation or any part thereof to a claimant if at the time of the award it has no notice or intimation of any dispute as to his entitlement; but the making of any such award shall not affect the entitlement to receive compensation under this Ordinance of any other person who may thereafter be held by a court of competent jurisdiction to have a better title to the compensation or any part thereof than the person to whom it was awarded.
An award of compensation under subsection (2) shall not in any way affect the entitlement of a mortgagee to be paid compensation in accordance with section 32.

Subject to subsection (2), a mortgagee of land which reverts to the Government or vests in The Financial Secretary Incorporated under this Ordinance shall, in so far as he has priority as against any other mortgagee, be entitled to be paid so much of any compensation as is required to discharge his mortgage debt including any interest thereon. (Amended L.N. 180 of 1985; 29 of 1998 s. 105)

If compensation is payable under this Ordinance otherwise than for land resumed or if the land to which compensation relates is part only of the mortgage security a mortgagee shall, in so far as he has priority as against any other mortgagee, be entitled to be paid so much of the compensation as is necessary to reduce his mortgage debt to an amount which is adequately secured by the land or the remaining land as the case may be.

The payment of compensation, as required by subsections (1) and (2), shall be made in accordance with the written agreement of the claimant and every mortgagee of the land or failing such agreement in accordance with an order of the High Court under subsection (4).

The claimant or any mortgagee may apply to the High Court for an order as to the payment of unpaid compensation and on any such application the Court may make such order as it thinks just and equitable having regard to the requirements of subsections (1) and (2).

subsection.leadIn: The Lands Tribunal may direct that interest be paid on compensation (but not on costs)— (Amended 6 of 2001 s. 9)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of compensation payable under item 1 of Part II of the Schedule, as if the claim were made under the Lands Resumption Ordinance (Cap. 124) for land resumed under that Ordinance; and (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 78)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, from such date and for such period as it thinks fit. (Amended 6 of 2001 s. 9; 25 of 2023 s. 83)

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)(b), the rate of interest payable—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in respect of a day other than a publication day—is the reference interest rate published on the last publication day before that day. (Replaced 25 of 2023 s. 83)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: reference interest rate (參考利率) means the 1-month Hong Kong Dollar Interest Settlement Rate published by The Hong Kong Association of Banks by the close of business on a day. (Replaced 25 of 2023 s. 83)

editorialNote.content: For the validation of interest payments and application provisions relating to the amendments made by 6 of 2001—see section 13 of 6 of 2001.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Compensation payable out of general revenue
section.leadIn: All compensation (including any interest thereon) and all costs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: agreed to be paid to the claimant by the Secretary; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: awarded by the Lands Tribunal against the Government, (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 90)

section.continued: shall be paid out of the general revenue within 3 months of the agreement or final award, unless there is a dispute as to the person entitled to such compensation.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Surrender of title documents
section.content: The Secretary may require any claimant to whom compensation is payable for land resumed under this Ordinance to surrender his documents of title to the Secretary as a condition of payment being made; and in any case where the documents of title relate also to land not resumed, the Secretary shall return them to the claimant after the resumption has been noted in the register of the land kept in the Land Registry.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Certain statements to be conclusive evidence

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in any order under section 13(1), 15(1) or 17(1) respectively that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the resumption of land;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the creation of an easement or other right; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the closure, reclamation, extinction, modification or restriction,

paragraph.continued: is ordered or declared for the purposes of or incidental to the works or the use; or (Amended 8 of 1987 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a notice under section 19, 20 or 21 that the entry or the work therein described or required to be carried out is, in the opinion of the Secretary, in connexion with the works, the use, an assessment of the value of any land, building or other property or in order to ascertain the condition of the land or building or necessary or required for the works or the use; or

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: only involve minor physical or structural operations; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: only create minimal adverse effect on the road users and other people in the neighbourhood; or (Replaced 25 of 2023 s. 84)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a road does not serve any useful purpose or does not serve any lawful purpose,

section.continued: then such statement must be accepted by all courts, tribunals and persons as conclusive evidence of the truth of the fact so stated. (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 84)

section.name: s37
section.heading: Disposal of lands and easements
section.leadIn: Any land resumed or any Government foreshore or sea-bed reclaimed or any easement or other right created under this Ordinance and any land which becomes vested in The Financial Secretary Incorporated may be used in such manner as the Government or The Financial Secretary Incorporated thinks fit and may be disposed of to any person by any means and on any terms whatsoever. (Amended L.N. 180 of 1985)

section.name: s37A
section.heading: Absence of authorization of expenditure for works or use not prevent certain matters
section.leadIn: The fact that the expenditure for any works or any use has not been approved or authorized under the Public Finance Ordinance (Cap. 2) or any other enactment does not prevent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the authorization of the works or the use under section 4 or 11(1), (2), (4) or (5);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the exercise of a power under section 11(7), 13, 15, 17, 19, 20, 21, 22 or 23; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the provision of any compensation (whether monetary or non-monetary) or any financial or other assistance, whether or not under an enactment, in connection with the works or the use.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Certain Ordinances not to apply
section.leadIn: Except to the extent that provision is otherwise made in this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Lands Resumption Ordinance (Cap. 124) shall not apply to the resumption of any land ordered under section 13 nor to any claim for or determination, award or payment of compensation for such resumption; (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 78)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Foreshore and Sea-bed (Reclamations) Ordinance (Cap. 127) shall not apply to an order made under section 17(1) nor to the implementation or effects thereof; and (Amended 63 of 1985 s. 21)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) shall not apply to the works or use for the purpose of giving rise to any claim for compensation.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Transitional provisions for Development (Town Planning, Lands and Works) (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2023

subsection.content: If a copy of a plan and scheme has been deposited in the Land Registry under section 8(1) before 1 September 2023, sections 8(3), 10, 11, 14, 16 and 18 as in force immediately before that date continue to apply in relation to the plan and scheme as if sections 76(2), 77, 78, 79, 80 and 81 of the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

Section 23(1A) has effect in relation to any application to be made under section 23(1) on or after 1 September 2023, regardless of whether the date referred to in section 23(1A)(a)(i) or (ii) falls before, on or after 1 September 2023.
The amendment made to section 37 by section 85 of the Amendment Ordinance has effect in relation to any land resumed (whether before, on or after 1 September 2023) under this Ordinance.

If the period specified in the fourth column of Part II of the Schedule in relation to a matter specified in the first column of that Part begins before 1 September 2023, section 33 as in force immediately before that date continues to apply in relation to the compensation in respect of the matter as if section 83 of the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Amendment Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Development (Town Planning, Lands and Works) (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2023 (25 of 2023).

section.name: s1
section.heading: General effect of this Part
section.leadIn: The provisions in this Part shall, where applicable, have effect for the purpose of assessing compensation under Part II of this Schedule and shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in addition to such of the provisions of the Lands Resumption Ordinance (Cap. 124) as apply, by virtue of Part II, to the assessment of compensation; and (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 78)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prevail over any provision referred to in subparagraph (a) which is inconsistent or in conflict with a provision in this Part.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Definitions applicable to Part II
section.def: date of resumption (收回日期) means the day on which land reverts to the Government or vests in The Financial Secretary Incorporated under section 13(3); (Amended L.N. 180 of 1985; 29 of 1998 s. 105)

disturbance (騷擾) means the dispossession of a person of land or the interruption of or interference with a trade or business, whether such dispossession, interruption or interference is temporary or permanent;

def.name: DisturbancePayment
def.leadIn: disturbance payment (騷擾補償金) means a sum equal to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the expenditure and loss of money actually and reasonably incurred or to be reasonably incurred and arising from the dispossession of a person of land by reason of the matter for which the claimant is entitled to claim compensation under Part II of the Schedule; and

content.leadIn: in the case of disturbance of a trade or business on any land, the expenditure and loss of money actually and reasonably incurred or to be reasonably incurred and arising from the disturbance of that trade or business by reason of the matter for which the claimant is entitled to claim compensation under Part II of the Schedule:

def.proviso: Provided that a disturbance payment shall not include any expenditure or loss which would not be recoverable, on the grounds that the expenditure or loss was too remote or was not caused by the disturbance, if that disturbance were a tort;

section.def: open market value (公開市場價值) means the amount which the land, if sold in the open market by a willing seller, might reasonably be expected to realize.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Fluctuations in value of land
section.content: Subject to paragraphs 8 and 10, where the open market value of any land is relevant for the purposes of assessing compensation under this Ordinance, no account shall be taken of any increase or decrease in that value which is attributable to anything done or proposed to be done under this Ordinance or to the use.

subsection.content: For the purposes of assessing the amount to be awarded to a claimant in respect of a disturbance payment, the Lands Tribunal shall, in respect of any expenditure or loss to be incurred and in respect of which the claimant is entitled under this Ordinance to be compensated, assess the value of that expenditure or loss at the time of the award as if that expenditure or loss formed part of a claim for damages in tort.
No disturbance payment shall be payable in respect of any interference with a trade or business in any case in which such interference does not subsist for a period exceeding 14 days.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Unlawful building works
section.content: Compensation may be reduced so far as may be just and equitable in respect of any building or part thereof which has been constructed or modified, or on which building works have been carried out, so as to amount to a contravention of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) being a contravention within the meaning of that Ordinance or to a contravention of a Government lease or other instrument under which land built upon is held.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Compensation where damage results only partly from the works
section.content: The compensation assessed under item 6 or 7 of Part II of this Schedule shall be reduced to such extent as may be just and equitable having regard to the share in the responsibility for the loss or damage not reasonably attributable to or connected with the works.

section.name: s7
section.heading: No compensation under item 8 for loss of advertising
section.content: Where a sign advertising any business, product, service or activity is removed under section 21, nothing in item 8 of Part II of this Schedule shall be construed as conferring upon any person a right to compensation for the loss of any benefit which might have accrued to him from the advertising of that business, product, service or activity if the sign had not been removed.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Set off where compensation paid for loss of value and land later resumed
section.content: Where compensation under item 2, 3, 4, 5, 8 or 9 of Part II of this Schedule has been paid in respect of the diminution in value of any land and such land or part thereof is subsequently resumed by the Government under this Ordinance or any other enabling power, then notwithstanding paragraph 3 of this Part of this Schedule or any other provision of law to the same or similar effect, that diminution in value shall be taken into account to reduce the compensation for the resumption of that land in so far as it was taken into account in the assessment of compensation for the diminuting in value thereof.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Claim by a mortgagee in possession
section.leadIn: Where under this Ordinance a claim for compensation may be made by a mortgagee in possession— (Amended L.N. 307 of 1998)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: such claim may include compensation in respect of the whole interest which comprises the mortgage security; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: compensation received by a mortgagee in possession shall be applied by him firstly, to the settlement or reduction of the debt due under the mortgage and then to the payment of any excess to the mortgagor.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Limitation on compensation payable under item 9
section.content: Compensation shall be payable under item 9 of Part II of this Schedule only to the extent that the carrying out of building works in accordance with an amendment required, or condition imposed, under section 22(1)(c) or (d) does not increase the open market value of the land on which the building works are carried out.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Apportionment of compensation
section.content: Where there is a dispute between persons owning compensatable interests in any land or building as to the apportionment of the compensation payable or paid, the Lands Tribunal shall, on the application of any such person, apportion that compensation amongst such persons in such manner as may be just and equitable having regard to their respective rights and interests in the land or building.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Date of valuation and interest
section.content: Where, under the second column of Part II of this Schedule, compensation is to be assessed on the basis of the value of land, or the value of a claimant’s interest in land, or of a rent, that value or that rent shall be assessed as at the date of the happening of the relevant event mentioned in the first column of Part II of this Schedule; and the person entitled to claim shall be the person fitting the description mentioned in the third column of Part II of this Schedule on that date.

section.name: s13
section.heading: No double compensation
section.leadIn: Nothing in this Ordinance shall enable any person to recover compensation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of a loss or expense which he has not suffered or incurred; or

content.leadIn: which is greater than the loss suffered or expense incurred by him:

section.proviso: Provided that in assessing compensation under this Ordinance, no account shall be taken of any amount recovered by the claimant under a policy of insurance.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Government may undertake work
section.content: Where, under this Ordinance, a person is entitled to claim compensation and that compensation is to be assessed on the basis of an expense incurred, the Government may, on written notice to that person, carry out the operations in respect of which the expense would otherwise be claimable.
